msContents.summary: Report of tax overseers; entries include payment for taxes on Syrian wool, shepherds, an Egyptian drug; entries are listed under geographic headings which include the villages Psenephtha, Phenyletheines, the city of Isis

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; back blank
34 lines; broken at right and bottom
The hand is a fluent cursive

div.ab: and from Menos son of Horos son of Pmochis . . .and from Heros son of Hermes from Pso- . . . and drachmas equally P.eso . . . and partner and from Horos son of Her- . . . [l. 5] son of Pmochis in the following . . . execution of farming taxes . . . collected from Thoth until . . . of Syrian wool and shepherds shown under and. . . Areios . . . [l. 10] and . . . following . . . of Egyptian medicine shown under and. . . Areios . . . Herakle- from Thoth until Ph- . . . Euth- Terphil- . . . [l. 15] on the dealers in condiments . . . for the boats of Phem- . . . to Ekalachis and Psameoul- . . . shown under and . . . Areios . . . Hera- . . . [l. 20] from Thoth until Pauni . . . Psenephtha . . . shown to be . . . from Thoth until Pauni . . . Phenyleitheineus shown to be under . . . 39 from Thoth until . . . [l. 25] of the polis of Isis . . . shown to be . . . Papeskos from Thoth until . . . seven villages Teichoe- . . . [l. 30] of Pepteuros from Thoth until . . . Ischyrion son of Eutho- from Mecheir until . . . taxes.
